title: I'm getting worse at the game. Why?
body:
Whenever I pick champions that I feel confident it, I get rekt in lane or I consistently get ganked by the entire enemy team. One only has to look at my match history to realise that I am quite bad. How can I get out of this "tilt". I know how to play, but I just seem unable to apply the theory into my gameplay. I am quite knowledgeable of the game, I just suck at playing it. My friend thinks it's because of the time I spend on the boards, and I'm picking up a lot of different playstyles that aren't my own. 

I really need help, because it's really starting to annoy me.

replies.body: Take a break. Easiest way to get out of tilt.
So what, no League for a week? A month?

However long it takes. 

A week or a fortnight of focusing on other games or activities should help you "reset".
Okay, I have HSC Trials in a couple of weeks anyway. Could probably use the extra study time.

Since I stopped taking the game so seriously I've act climbed from mid silver to promos for plat. I've learnt to look at every loss as a lesson and to see what I can learn from it. Helped me heaps. Also stop worrying about your mmr if that's what's making you anxious. Your goal should be to improve long term, not make quick gains as it really is fool's gold.
I give up on League for 2 or 3 days sometimes. Or just play with a bunch of friends and turn it into just fun rather than something more "stressful"
Hmmm... I would try this, but I have no friends that could make it "less serious". They play to win and despise trolling of any kind.

> [{quoted}](name=DiamondAries,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=2u7a5AOd,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-06-15T04:25:14.184+0000)
>
> Hmmm... I would try this, but I have no friends that could make it "less serious". They play to win and despise trolling of any kind.

I think it's fitting to play some hexakills, participate in events like Find the Teemo or something. You need to take some time off ranked games and start enjoying the fun side of LoL. For me, I usually get tilted because of the desire to climb but that has very adverse effect on my own mental health. You get more frustrated when you lose and that in turn translates onto the next game. This will continue to multiply until the very end where you will have a prolonged losing streak. By this time, you're almost done with league forever. To prevent this, take some time off LoL, however long you need. It takes me approximately a week to recover (I'm on my break right now) and it will also help you during your HSC trials. We've all been there but remember to prioritise the exams over games, use it only as a form of relaxation therapy, not  a mechanism for more stress.

If you need a duo partner to play normals/hexakill/event games, I'm up for it.
Sweet, thanks man. Yeah I do prioritise my studies over League, I'm not that addicted to it xD
These are all very useful tips! The taking a break one really worked for me ages ago! Also, try playing different game modes and different champions/roles. Freshens you up!

Feeling confident and knowing how to play them are two different things, despite what people say. There a champs which you may see people play and go 'oh, he looks easy' and then you go and feed. But the simple way to put it is you don't understand the mechanics of the champ and why the person is playing it. Example being Ekko so many people playing him right now but are either a hit or miss in solo queue or norms where ever it be. But that is because they don't understand the combos or how much damage or even how to build him. When you are playing new champs it is best to understand what the best combo is for maximum damage and how much damage you are able to deal with this combo. A thing I regularly do even on champs I know how to play I constantly check how much damage each ability does after a item purchase just so I am able to calculate whether I am able to I can all in someone for a guaranteed kill.

As for tilt, best thing I find is simply removing myself from playing the game watch a movie or play some CS:GO whatever it may be, something that is remote from League is the best thing to do.

Is weird as it feels just try and forget about League. Force yourself not to think about it and pick other things to do with your time than play or even go on boards. Seriously, log out and close tab, it helps. If you are constantly feeling bad about how you are going in game there is no reason to keep playing. As soon as you forget that negativity will disappear because it will no longer matter.
